title: For all our balance criticism, THIS needs to be recognized
body:
I haven't seen a jungle this balanced for a long time. EVERY SINGLE jungle champion is very playable in the jungle and performs semi decently. Everything from bruisers to tanks to assassins like kha'zix and rengar to mages like fiddle, nidalee, and diana (if you wanna call them mages) and on hits like nocturne, warwick, and xin zhao are all very playable and show pretty solid results in the jungle

Now a lot of people will bring up winrate stats and other bullshit but champion.gg and my experience over during the games this patch have shown me that there's a lot to play right now. I think the state of the jungle and its current balance needs to be recognized

If this was true then high CC tanks would be competitive junglers. They're generally not.

To be a competitive jungler right now you need to be able to compete with cancer junglers like Nidalee and Elise in the early game. That is the only prerequisite to being a competitively viable jungler. The vast majority of champs cannot do this and as such can never be picked outside of extreme circumstances.

If you want any diversity in competitive jungling you need to systematically remove the strongest early game junglers. Right now that's Nid, Elise and Rek'sai, once you did that Lee, Graves and possibly a couple of other similar champs would be in the same position. If you once again remove those junglers you might see the viable jungle population rise from 4-5 to 8-9. There is no other way to increase jungle diversity at a competitive level, the early dominant junglers have too strong of a choke hold on the meta and always will.
